title: Display/ Script "Porcellino's"
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120248im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Por_4669.jpg)
 Display and/or Script...I have searched to identify the font...makes me wonder if it is perhaps a Bespoke typeface or manipulated from an original typeface?.

Thanks for all of your time, effort, energy, and attention...this is my first post. I am excited to be a part of typophile.

Have a great weekend!

Scott

Font: 

 gin 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120248/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")
author: orangetank

comments.content:
I suspect the script is calligraphy.

Some typefaces that mimic the look, more or less:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/argentina-lian-types/brand/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120248/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/argentina-lian-types/brand/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/argentina-lian-types/brand/")

The only typeface being used is Gin, for |CRAFT BUTCHER|:
